SENTRY INDUSTRIES INC.

RISK MANAGEMENT EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Since the founding of Sentry Industries in 1984, it has been our companyA?s policy to operate our facility in a manner and way to protect our employees, our community, and the environment. Through our policies, procedures and actions, our goal is to prevent accidents and chemical releases. Sentry Industries maintains our facility in accordance with all local, state, and federal requirements. Sentry Industries is an active member in the Chlorine Institute and follows the recommendations for the safe handling of hazardous materials. Sentry Industries is also a member of the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) District 11.

Sentry Industries manufactures and distributes water treatment chemicals to wholesalers and service companies throughout South Florida. Sentry Industries manufactures sodium hypochlorite (bleach), along with other goods and services, which are used to sanitize private and public swimming pools and in the sanitization of drinking water and wastewater treatment.  

Sentry Industries Risk Management Plan encompasses all of the required elements of the RMP and PSM rules and the following written procedures:
1.    Standard Operating Procedures 
2.    Preventative Maintenance Program 
3.    Operator Training Programs
4.    Safety Manual
5.    Chemical Accident Prevention Plan
6.    Site Emergency Response Plan
7.    Accident Investigation Procedures
8.    Fleet Safety Manual
9.    Site Security Program

Sentry Industries has taken the following steps to ensure our safe handling of hazardous materials in the community:
* State of the art valve closure system to close process valves in case of: detection of releases to the atmosphere, safety equipment failure, loss of utilities including electric and air, movement, sudden drop in pressure and remote emergency switches to manually operate emergency shutdown system.
* Redundant safety systems.
* All systems designed and operated per industry standards and codes.
* Monitor

ing system that will automatically shut the process valves and alert plant personnel, if it detects releases to the atmosphere.
* Comply with OSHA Process Safety Management rule and EPA's Risk Management Plan.
* Equipment checks and preventative maintenance programs in place.
* Procedures in place for the safe and secure movement of raw materials.
* Only trained personnel allowed to receive and process raw materials.
* Written Standard Operating Procedures for operators to follow.
* Annual auditing of procedures and operations.
* A scrubber system to pull a vacuum on hoses and piping systems.
* Work with all state and local agencies to improve not only our safety, but also  the industries safety commitment overall.
* Security procedures and employee training for the protection of our employees, the community, and the environment, as well as, protection of the company assets.
* Sentry Industries has a Site Emergency Response Plan that has been coordinated with the community plan.  We have and will continue to work with the local fire department though training and drills to improve our response to any problem that may arise.

In the past five years, Sentry Industries has NOT experienced an accidental release and has been recognized every year with an Environmental/Process Safety Award.
